scenario_text.value:
(It’s obvious how screwy things are between
Shuuji and Lopmon, even from the outside.)
(How’re things are with Miu and Syakomon?)
Hey Syakomon, check out this nut!
Nut? Isn’t that just an acorn?

As if! This is a magic nut that turns into
the World Tree when it’s big and strong!

Whoa, really?! You sure we should be messing
with that?!

All I’m saying is that this thing is packed
with power!

And then we have... Ah, here! The Stone of
Sealing!
What, that pebble?

A fiendish demon is sealed inside! They say
it’s still alive and kicking in there.

Look, you can still feel the eeevil energy
seeping out of it.

I, I mean it feels a bit damp, sure. Do you
think we should be touching this?

No worries, I’m keeping it at bay with my
spirit power!
You’re amazing, Miu!
Ha ha, what the heck is this?
Ah, Takuma! Agumon!
Wooow, I had no idea you were so cool, Miu!
Right?! That’s some crazy power she’s got!
Mweh-heh-heh, that’s right, I AM cool!
*sigh*
(Miu sure is putting on a show for them.)

(Still, she must have a reason for putting up
a front like that.)
Hey, Takuma...
Yeah?
What do you think about a kid like me?

(A kid like Miu? Here she is with those vague
questions again...)

(I guess she’s kinda cute, in her weird way?
She seems to be popular with some people.)

(The idea of spirit power is honestly kinda
cool. You see it a bunch in movies.)

(Still, watching Miu make believe like that
feels kinda sad. Should I tell her to stop?)
(What should I say to her?)
Weirdos are cute?
Spirit power’s cool!
You should stop this.

Well, I guess weirdos can be considered kinda
cute, right?
Wha’⁠—cute? That’s what someone would think?

Huh, what gives? Is there something wrong
with being thought of that way?
Not wrong in itself, it’s just...

Being called cute by an older boy is...kinda
scary...

(Scary? I wonder what that means. Did
I trigger a bad memory?)
Maybe I should knock it off, then.

Uh, well shouldn’t you just do whatever comes
naturally?

Living your own way, blowing off what others
think of you⁠—that sounds more your style!
Oh, so that’s your impression of me, huh?
All right, that works for me.

Spirit powers are pretty cool! I kinda wish
I had some myself.

Yeah? I mean, yeah! Who wouldn’t love
a little spookiness in their lives?

Sure. And hey, if you’re having fun, all the
better.
All the better? How do you figure?

Seeing you all hyped up about whatever you’re
into is the best look for you, I’d say.

Seeing you happy instead of depressed or sad
makes me feel relieved.
Huh, for real? You think my smile’s the best?
Heheh...

(She looks happy. I guess she likes getting
praised for the shows she puts on.)

Uh, Miu... Just know that I’m saying this for
your sake.

I think you should stop putting on such
a show. I’m sure you’ll regret it later.

Hey, who’s putting on a show?! This is just
who I am!

C’mon, all that talk of weird powers is
clearly fake! Don’t worry, everyone gets it.
What? Everyone thinks the same?

I see. Guess I can’t expect them to just take
it at face value...

(Take it at face value? What’s that mean? Did
something happen to Miu in the past?)

Um, well you know how me and Kaito moved here
not too long ago, right?
Yeah, Kaito told me.

Things got kinda, well, dicey in the last
place we lived, so we moved here.
Kinda dicey...?

Yeah, dicey. Kaito’s been a pain in my behind
ever since.

He always tries to stick close to me, and
blows his top at the slightest thing...

I hate him doing that, so I always try to act
all happy and stuff.
I had no idea...

Well, it sounds like the spirit power thing
isn’t helping, but that’s fine.

It feels way safer than acting like regular
old me.

(Feels safer, huh? So Miu puts on a show of
acting free and easy to guard herself.)

You know, you’re pretty easy to talk to,
Takuma.
Let’s do it again soon.
Hey Syakomon, Agumon! Check this out!

(She acts all easy-breezy, but even Miu has
her own issues to grapple with.)

Don’t worry about me! My spirit power keeps
me nice and safe.
